intro: Guettarda ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical in shape, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
